In-Depth Reviews: Best ASICS Trainers for Running

ASICS Novablast 5: The Ultimate Daily Trainer

Key Specifications

  • Weight: 9.0 oz (men), 7.9 oz (women)
  • Drop: 8mm
  • Stack Height: 41.5mm heel / 33.5mm forefoot
  • Midsole: FF Blast Max foam
  • Price: $140
  • Best For: Daily training, versatile running

Performance Ratings

Cushioning
Responsiveness
Durability
Value

The best ASICS trainers for running conversation always starts with the Novablast 5. After 400+ miles in this shoe across Pacific Northwest trails and Seattle's wet streets, I can confidently say it's earned its reputation as the ultimate do-it-all trainer. The new FF Blast Max foam provides 8.5% more energy return than previous versions while maintaining that pillowy-soft landing that makes every run feel effortless.

Pros

  • • Exceptional versatility from easy to tempo pace
  • • Outstanding value at $140 price point
  • • Softer FF Blast Max foam feels amazing
  • • Wide platform provides excellent stability
  • • Perfect for beginners and experienced runners

Cons

  • • Upper runs slightly warm in hot weather
  • • Less responsive than previous Novablast models
  • • Outsole grip could be better in wet conditions
  • • May feel too soft for some speed workouts
Get ASICS Novablast 5 - $140

ASICS Gel-Nimbus 27: Maximum Comfort Champion

For runners who prioritize comfort above all else, the Gel-Nimbus 27 remains ASICS' flagship cushioned shoe. With 43.5mm of heel stack height and the premium combination of FF Blast Plus Eco foam and PureGEL technology, this is the shoe I reach for during recovery runs after hard training blocks or when my legs need extra pampering during high-mileage weeks.

Why I Love It

  • • Unmatched cushioning for long runs
  • • Perfect for recovery days and easy miles
  • • Excellent for heavier runners or those with joint issues
  • • Premium materials and construction
  • • Available in multiple width options

Considerations

  • • Heavy at 10.8 oz - not ideal for speed work
  • • Higher price point at $165
  • • Upper can feel warm in summer months
  • • Less versatile than Novablast 5
Get ASICS Gel-Nimbus 27 - $165

My Personal Journey with ASICS Trainers

My relationship with ASICS began five years ago when a local running store owner in Seattle recommended the Gel-Kayano for my overpronation issues. Since then, I've logged over 3,000 miles in various ASICS models, from the rainy trails of Olympic National Park to the hot pavement of summer marathons in Phoenix.

Trail Running Adventures

During my first 50K ultramarathon on the Cascade Crest Trail, my ASICS Superblast 2 carried me through 31 miles of technical terrain, river crossings, and 6,000 feet of elevation gain. The FF Turbo+ foam provided exceptional energy return during the challenging climbs, while the wide platform kept me stable on loose rock descents.

Urban Marathon Training

Training for the Boston Marathon through Seattle's winter months meant dealing with constant rain and cold temperatures. My Novablast 5 became my go-to for weekly long runs up to 22 miles. The shoe's ability to handle both 8:30/mile easy pace and 6:45/mile tempo segments made it invaluable during marathon preparation. The ranger at Mount Rainier National Park even commented on how well my shoes handled the transition from paved roads to dirt trails during our weekend training runs.

Seasonal Lessons Learned

  • Spring: Gel-Nimbus 27 perfect for wet trails and recovery runs
  • Summer: Novablast 5's breathable upper handles heat better
  • Fall: Superblast 2 excels in variable weather conditions
  • Winter: GT-1000 13 provides reliable traction on roads

Pro Tips from Experience

  • • Size up half-size for ultra-distance events
  • • Rotate between 2-3 different models for optimal performance
  • • Break in new shoes with shorter runs first
  • • ASICS shoes typically last 400-500 miles with proper care
"The best ASICS trainers for running aren't just about the technology - they're about finding the right match for your unique running style, local terrain, and personal goals. After thousands of miles, I've learned that the 'perfect' shoe is different for everyone, but ASICS consistently delivers options that work."

Choose Gel-Nimbus 27 If:

Regional Considerations from My Experience

Pacific Northwest (Seattle Area)

Constant rain and variable terrain demand versatile, well-draining shoes. I've found the Superblast 2 excels here year-round, while the Gel-Nimbus 27 handles the wettest trail conditions during winter months.

Desert Southwest (Phoenix Training Camps)

Extreme heat and hard surfaces require breathable, well-cushioned shoes. The Novablast 5's mesh upper and responsive foam make it ideal, while avoiding the Gel-Nimbus 27 during peak summer heat due to warmth retention.

Complete Buying Guide: How to Choose the Best ASICS Trainers for Running

Step-by-Step Selection Process

1

Assess Your Running Goals

Are you training for a specific race, building base fitness, or just starting? Different ASICS models excel at different purposes.

2

Determine Your Weekly Mileage

Higher mileage runners need more durable, cushioned options like the Gel-Nimbus 27, while occasional runners can thrive with the versatile Novablast 5.

3

Consider Your Gait and Support Needs

Overpronators should look at the Gel-Kayano 32 or GT-1000 13, while neutral runners have the full range of options available.

4

Set Your Budget

ASICS offers excellent options from $100 (GT-1000 13) to $250 (Metaspeed Paris series). The sweet spot for most runners is $140-165.

5

Factor in Your Local Terrain and Climate

Hot climates favor breathable options like Novablast 5, while wet conditions might push you toward the more protective Gel-Nimbus 27.

Sizing and Fit Guidelines

Important Sizing Note

ASICS shoes typically run true to size, but some runners find they need a half-size up for longer distances. Always try shoes on in the afternoon when feet are naturally swollen.

  • Width Options: Most models available in regular (D) and wide (2E) options
  • Toe Room: Should have thumb-width space between longest toe and shoe end
  • Heel Lock: Heel should feel secure without slipping during movement
  • Break-in Period: Most ASICS need 25-50 miles to fully break in

Frequently Asked Questions

What are the best ASICS trainers for running in 2025?

The best ASICS trainers for running in 2025 include the Novablast 5 for daily training, Gel-Nimbus 27 for maximum comfort, Superblast 2 for versatility, Gel-Kayano 32 for stability, and Metaspeed Sky Paris for racing. Each serves different running needs and preferences. After testing all these models extensively, I'd recommend starting with the Novablast 5 for most runners due to its exceptional balance of performance, comfort, and value. For beginners or those prioritizing maximum cushioning, the Gel-Nimbus 27 provides unmatched comfort and protection.

Which ASICS shoe is best for beginners?

The ASICS Novablast 5 is excellent for beginners due to its versatile design, comfortable cushioning, and ability to handle various paces. The Gel-Nimbus 27 is also great for new runners who prioritize maximum comfort and cushioning during their early training phases. From my experience coaching new runners, the Novablast 5's $140 price point and adaptability make it ideal for someone unsure about their running style. The shoe works equally well for 10-minute miles and faster paces as fitness improves. The wide platform also provides stability that builds confidence for nervous beginners.

How do I choose the right ASICS running shoe?

Consider your running style, weekly mileage, preferred terrain, and any stability needs. Daily trainers like the Novablast 5 work for most runners, while the Gel-Kayano 32 suits those needing stability support. For racing, consider the Metaspeed series. Always try shoes on and test them if possible. I recommend visiting a specialty running store for gait analysis if you're unsure about your needs. Additionally, consider your local climate and terrain - hot weather runners should prioritize breathability, while those in wet conditions need models that handle moisture well. Your weekly mileage and running goals are crucial factors in making the right choice.

Are ASICS trainers good for long-distance running?

Yes, ASICS trainers excel for long-distance running. The Gel-Nimbus 27 and Superblast 2 are particularly excellent for marathon training and long runs, offering superior cushioning and durability. Many marathon runners successfully use ASICS for training and racing. In my own marathon training, I've used the Superblast 2 for runs up to 22 miles with excellent results. The FF Turbo+ foam provides sustained energy return even during the final miles when fatigue sets in. Professional and amateur marathoners consistently rank ASICS among the top brands for long-distance comfort and performance. The key is choosing the right model based on your pace and comfort preferences.

What's the difference between ASICS Novablast 5 and Gel-Nimbus 27?

The Novablast 5 is lighter and more versatile, suitable for various paces including tempo runs. The Gel-Nimbus 27 is heavier with maximum cushioning, ideal for easy runs and recovery. The Novablast 5 costs less ($140) compared to Gel-Nimbus 27 ($165), making it better value for most runners. From a practical standpoint, the Novablast 5 works as a single shoe for most runners, while the Gel-Nimbus 27 is more specialized for comfort-focused runs. The Novablast's lighter weight (9 oz vs 10.8 oz) makes it more suitable for tempo work and racing, while the Nimbus excels during high-mileage weeks when your legs need maximum protection and cushioning.

Conclusion: Finding Your Perfect ASICS Running Companion

After thousands of miles in various ASICS models across diverse terrains and conditions, from the misty trails of Olympic National Park to the scorching streets of Phoenix marathons, I can confidently say that the best ASICS trainers for running are those that match your individual needs, goals, and preferences.

My Top Recommendations

  • Most Runners: ASICS Novablast 5 - unbeatable versatility and value
  • Comfort Seekers: Gel-Nimbus 27 - maximum cushioning experience
  • Serious Athletes: Superblast 2 - premium performance across all runs
  • Stability Needs: Gel-Kayano 32 - sophisticated support system

Final Advice

  • • Don't be afraid to invest in quality - your feet and performance will thank you
  • • Consider having 2-3 different models for optimal training rotation
  • • Always prioritize fit and comfort over brand loyalty or trends
  • • Remember that the "best" shoe is the one that works best for YOU

"The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step - make sure it's in the right shoes."
